values.title: Staff Software Engineer

values.summary:
SUMMARY
Dedicated teamplayer with an attitude towards learning. Designed, implemented, debugged, tested and documented various portions of system software. Solid experience in software design and development focusing within the Operating System (OS) on file systems  and  NFS client / server implementations.

MAJOR ACCOMPLISHMENTS

• Implemented complex directory rename in cloud computing server product. 

• Designed, implemented, and bringup of NFSv2 and NFSv3 in first releases of NAS server product. 

• Designed and implemented new functionality within the file system in first releases of NAS server product. 

• Stabilized the NFS (Network File System) client and server code in newly marketed Operating System, (OS X, OS 10.1), making it functional with various UNIX and Macintosh platforms running NFSv2, NFSv3 on UDP and TCP, with  both UFS and HFS+ as local file systems. 

• Critical knowledge of file systems within proprietary OSs and UNIX. Both standard and object oriented techniques observed with an eye on producing well-performing reliable code with languages Mesa, C, and C++.

• Part of team that designed and implemented a highly reliable robust file system volume format replacing the need of specialized hardware, thus resulting in cost savings for end product (Xerox workstations and servers).

• Continually solidified and enhanced code bases for release cycles by perseverance to add features and fix bugs.

3. Extensive experience with Internet based applications in a variety of domains including Healthcare, Enterprise Invoice/Bill Presentment and Payment, Data Security Management and Theft Protection, SOX Compliance and Financial Systems, Windows SDK and Linux, Knowledge Management and context-based indexing, and so on.
4.  Professional Services and Project Management – over 15 years of intense project management experience with clients such as Dell, Office Depot, Blue Cross & Blue Shield, Pacific Healthcare, Nelson Staffing, Smart Modular, etc. Managed projects ranging from 5 to 150+ engineers with budgets up to several millions of dollars. Very familiar with Agile, Scrums, and Sprints, especially, managing Agile across multiple facilities.
5.  Quality Assurance – directly managed QA teams ranging from 5 engineers to 125+ engineers (multiple product teams), instituted QA metrics for coverage for manual testing as well as automation, extensive QA automation experience.
5.  Offshore Operations Management and Interfacing – Have set up off-shore teams for the last 12 years, and actually managed teams in India and China for leading ISVs such as CA Technologies, Hyperion, Yahoo!, Phoenix technologies, Merant, Autodesk, and so on. 

I am a US Citizen holding a PIO Card in India valid until 2018 and willing to and can travel freely between US, India and any other countries as needed.

values.headline: "Imagine engineers and technical managers as effective with people as with technology"

values.summary:
It's my experience that you can be a great engineer AND a great engineering manager. In fact, the best engineering managers are excellent engineers, they can cross into both worlds. It just takes training in the soft-skills, the interpersonal people skills.

I began my career as an aeronautical engineer employed at Rockwell International Corporation working on Skylab, Shuttle, Shuttle Tug, and meteorological satellite programs. I then decided I wanted to be more technical and received an M.S. in geophysics and worked as a programmer and researcher for the United States Geological Survey before returning to the flight performance group of Rockwell International. This time at Rockwell, I met four engineers and together we started a software development and systems engineering company focused on Department of Defense programs. I then decided I wanted more business education and so I received an MBA and progressed from program manager to director, to vice president of engineering, chief operations officer and general manager. I then left to join a printer start-up as product manager and director of corporate training, helping the company grow from half a million to over a quarter of a billion dollars in six years.

Throughout my career, it has been clear that, for whatever reason, I had a knack for training and coaching my direct reports to achieve extraordinary capabilities. I ultimately left the corporate world to start my own company dedicated to coaching and training engineers, scientists and technical professionals in the soft skills, the interpersonal people skills and management skills necessary to make the transition from engineer to leader and from engineering manager to engineering leader, and necessary to secure a long term technical career.

I think the difference that makes the difference in my training, coaching, and facilitation  is that I've done it myself.
values.title: President

values.specialties:
What sets me apart is that I’m an engineer and a scientist, so I speak the language and understand the engineers' mind-set. I’m also a businessman (MBA) and I translate the business aspect of technical work into engineering language.  And as a Master Practitioner of NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming), I understand the difference between understanding a concept and translating that understanding into real behavior.

I've also conducted trainings in China, England, and Italy (in Italian).
values.summary:
My specialty is coaching, training, and facilitating engineers, technical managers and executives in the inter-personal people skills, (i.e., the soft skills) necessary to excel in their engineering professions and management and leadership positions.

For the engineer it's about being able to contribute fully to the organization, not just with the "right" answer but also through presenting that answer so it will be heard and understood.

For the manager and executive it's about the personal flexibility and communication and management excellence that builds teams and motivates people to give that extra effort that makes the difference between a problem project and a project completed on time and in budget.

What I enjoy the most is being part of highly efficient and skilled delivery teams, providing business value in close collaboration with clients and developing complex systems.
